summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing dated September 3, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes updates on protests, Operation Legend, counter-terrorism, counter-intelligence, criminal investigations, financial crimes, cyber division activities, and other Washington news. The briefing mentions several ongoing investigations and legal cases, but contains minimal direct information about the Epstein case.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Mentioned multiple times in the briefing discussing protests, law enforcement responses, and the Durham investigation. He commented on various incidents including the Jacob Blake shooting and mail-in voting.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Frequently mentioned in relation to policies, statements, and political actions including defunding cities, election comments, and administration activities.

persons.name: Joe Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in context of campaign activities, planned visit to Kenosha, and responses to protests and violence.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Referenced in relation to newly released FBI documents from the Mueller investigation detailing circumstances around his firing.

persons.name: Robert Mueller
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with the Russia investigation and FBI documents being released.

persons.name: Joseph Mifsud
persons.context: Mentioned in context of FBI interview notes being made public from the Trump-Russia inquiry.

persons.name: Hunter Biden
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to holding a stake in a Chinese firm sanctioned for human rights violations.

persons.name: George Papadopoulos
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with Joseph Mifsud's FBI interview where Mifsud denied making offers to him.

persons.name: John Durham
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to the investigation into the Russia investigation, with Barr stating it won't affect the 2020 election.

persons.name: Nancy Pelosi
persons.context: Mentioned in controversy over visiting a San Francisco hair salon during COVID-19 restrictions.

persons.name: Jacob Blake
persons.context: Mentioned in context of the Kenosha police shooting and subsequent protests.

persons.name: Anthony Fauci
persons.context: Mentioned discussing coronavirus vaccine timeline and dismissing herd immunity strategy.

persons.name: Alexei Navalny
persons.context: Mentioned in relation to being poisoned with Novichok nerve agent, with international condemnation.

persons.name: Vladimir Putin
persons.context: Mentioned in connection with the poisoning of Alexei Navalny and warnings about Belarus.

persons.name: Mike Pompeo
persons.context: Mentioned discussing Sudan, sanctions on ICC officials, and China diplomacy restrictions.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned in context of FBI investigations and briefing requests.

connections.description: Trump as President and Barr as Attorney General, with Barr implementing and defending Trump administration policies.
Opposing candidates in the 2020 presidential election, frequently contrasted in the briefing.
Comey was FBI Director during Mueller's investigation, with Mueller's investigation examining Comey's firing.
Mifsud allegedly made offers to Papadopoulos during the 2016 campaign, though Mifsud denied this in FBI interviews.
Father-son relationship, with Hunter's business dealings being discussed in political context.
Barr oversees Durham's investigation into the origins of the Russia investigation.
Putin as Russian president and Navalny as opposition leader who was poisoned.

events.title: FBI News Briefing Release
events.description: Daily FBI Public Affairs News Briefing covering national and international news.

events.title: Jacob Blake Shooting
events.description: Police shooting of Jacob Blake in Kenosha, Wisconsin that sparked protests.

events.title: Biden Announces Kenosha Visit
events.description: Joe Biden announces plans to visit Kenosha, Wisconsin to meet with Jacob Blake's family.

events.title: Frank Aguilar Disappearance
events.description: Los Angeles firefighter Frank Aguilar went missing in Mexico, suspected kidnapping.

events.title: Sturgis Motorcycle Rally
events.description: Large motorcycle rally in South Dakota linked to coronavirus spread and first COVID-19 death.

events.title: Navalny Poisoning Confirmation
events.description: Germany confirms Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned with Novichok nerve agent.

events.title: US Sanctions ICC Officials
events.description: US imposes sanctions on International Criminal Court prosecutor Fatou Bensouda over Afghanistan investigation.

events.title: NSA Phone Data Collection Ruling
events.description: Appeals court finds NSA warrantless telephone data collection program illegal.

keyFacts: The document is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing covering a wide range of topics with minimal direct Epstein case information.
Attorney General William Barr made multiple statements on protests, the Jacob Blake case, and the Durham investigation.
New FBI documents from the Mueller investigation were released revealing details around James Comey's firing.
FBI interview notes with Maltese professor Joseph Mifsud were made public, showing denials about offers to George Papadopoulos.
The briefing covers extensive criminal investigations including drug cases, fraud, and other federal crimes across multiple states.
